section.title: Element default values and marshalling
section.para: Because of a "strange" way element default values in XML Schema work, people often get confused about its behavior. This section describes how this works.
When a class has an element property with the default value, and if a value is null, then the marshaller will not produce the corresponding element in XML:

example.title: Element defaults and XML

section.para: This is consistent with the XML Schema spec, where it essentially states that the element defaults do not kick in when the element is absent. Attribute default values do not have this problem, so if you can change the schema, changing it to an attribute is usually a better idea. Alternatively, depending on your expectation, setting the field to a default value in Java may achieve what you are looking for.
